body: Hi, just wanted to follow up.  This is working pretty well for me.  I downloaded the latest source, built and tested via the command line tool.  It does create the single GLB files with the embedded textures.   Thanks for the quick turnaround.

I ran into the same problem, but so far assimp v.5.0 still has an external link for the texture (((

from EmbedTextures fbx ->glb2...

@shtams it works for me with 5.0.1. You should try the following command
`.\assimp.exe export "input.fbx" "output.glb" -embtex`

issue.title: Embed textures when converting 3D models (AssImpCatalogItem)

repository.name: terriajs
repository.description: A library for building rich, web-based geospatial 2D & 3D data platforms.

issue.body:
[Assimp](https://github.com/assimp/assimp/blob/master/code/PostProcessing/EmbedTexturesProcess.cpp) has a `embtex` flag which can be used to embed textures in GLB - https://github.com/assimp/assimp/issues/2149

As far as I can tell [AssimpJS](https://github.com/kovacsv/assimpjs/) is not able to use this flag - we should investigate this.

At the moment we convert 3D models to GLTF - and have to manipulate image/texture paths so they are resolved correctly - which is a bit finicky. 

Converting models to GLB with embedded textures would make everything much simpler

See 

https://github.com/TerriaJS/terriajs/blob/ac40a113c3eeef0cbf2647963bba811ddf4d82c2/lib/Models/Catalog/Gltf/AssImpCatalogItem.ts#L67-L87

This would also add support for additional image formats as textures (eg `.tga`)

body:
I was also testing converting to glb with embedded textures with the "/test/models/Collada/duck.dae" 
While most glb Viewers will show the textures correctly but not all will.
The Original texture is a .bmp file wich gets embedded in the glb but the GLTF spec appears to only support png and jpg formats for textures.
In the official [Validator ](https://github.khronos.org/glTF-Validator/) can see the following error message  "Invalid MIME type 'image/bmp' for the texture source. Valid MIME types are ('image/jpeg', 'image/png').",   

Would it be possible to automatically convert textures when exporting to GLB to stay in Specification?

+1 @JSWorkspace1.

Exporting to glTF from many file formats i.e. the test models with tga/bmp textures do not work well in some viewers.

With imagemagick we could easily achieve this. What do you think @kimkulling ?

issue.title: Bug: Invalid Texture formats in converted glTF 2.0

labels.name: Question
labels.description: Global flag to mark questions from users

labels.name: glTF2.0
labels.description: Bugs related to the glTF2.0 format

labels.name: Export
labels.description: Bugs / Feature requests related to export.

repository.name: assimp
repository.description: The official Open-Asset-Importer-Library Repository. Loads 40+ 3D-file-formats into one unified and clean data structure.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Moved to own Issue from #2149   :
The glTFâ„¢ 2.0 Specification only supports .jpg, and .png File Formats for textures.
When converting Models with different texture formats these will be kept, resulting in an invalid gltf or .glb.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1.Test using the  "/test/models/Collada/duck.dae" model 
2. Convert to .glb for via  .\assimp.exe export "duck.dae" "output.glb" -embtex
3. In the official [Validator ](https://github.khronos.org/glTF-Validator/)can see the following error message "Invalid MIME type 'image/bmp' for the texture source. Valid MIME types are ('image/jpeg', 'image/png').",

**Expected behavior**
Valid .gltf/.glb after converting.

**Additional context**
@Abde5 Suggested: "Exporting to glTF from many file formats i.e. the test models with tga/bmp textures do not work well in some viewers. With imagemagick we could easily achieve this. "
